Define.comment:
DTYPE configuration array size
must always be kept equal to (WMI_RF_DTYPE_LENGTH+1)
Define.name: WMI_RF_DTYPE_CONF_LENGTH

Define.comment:
ETYPE configuration array size
must always be kept equal to (WMI_RF_ETYPE_LENGTH+WMI_RF_ETYPE_VAL_PER_RANGE)
Define.name: WMI_RF_ETYPE_CONF_LENGTH

Define.comment:
RX2TX configuration array size
must always be kept equal to (WMI_RF_RX2TX_LENGTH+1)
Define.name: WMI_RF_RX2TX_CONF_LENGTH

fifo_watermark

Member.name: t_burst

Member.name: n_samples

Member.name: first_sample_offset

Member.name: samples_to_avg

Member.comment: TX RF to use on current pulse

Member.name: tx_rf_gain_comp
Member.comment: Offset from calibrated value.(expected to be 0)(value is row in Gain-LUT, not dB)

Member.name: rx_rfc_idx
Member.comment: RX RF to use on current pulse

Member.name: rx_rf_gain_comp
Member.comment: Offset from calibrated value.(expected to be 0)(value is row in Gain-LUT, not dB)

Member.name: rx_timing_offset
Member.comment: Offset from calibrated value.(expected to be 0)

Member.name: tx_rfc_idx
Member.comment: In the range of [0,7], 0xff means use default

Struct.comment:
WMI_DEEP_ECHO_CMDID
Check FW and uCode is alive
Returned event: WMI_DEEP_ECHO_RSP_EVENTID
Struct.name: DEEP_ECHO

Struct.comment:
WMI_RF_PWR_ON_DELAY_CMDID
set FW time parameters used through RF resetting
 RF reset consists of bringing its power down for a period of time, then bringing the power up
Returned event: WMI_RF_PWR_ON_DELAY_RSP_EVENTID
Struct.name: RF_PWR_ON_DELAY

Member.comment: time in usec the FW waits after bringing the RF PWR down,\nset 0 for default\n
Member.name: down_delay_usec

Member.comment: time in usec the FW waits after bringing the RF PWR up,\nset 0 for default\n
Member.name: up_delay_usec

Struct.comment:
WMI_SET_HIGH_POWER_TABLE_PARAMS_CMDID
This API controls the Tx and Rx gain over temperature.
It controls the Tx D-type, Rx D-type and Rx E-type amplifiers.
It also controls the Tx gain index, by controlling the Rx to Tx gain index offset.
The control is divided by 3 temperature values to 4 temperature ranges.
Each parameter uses its own temperature values.
Returned event: WMI_SET_HIGH_POWER_TABLE_PARAMS_EVENTID
Struct.name: SET_HIGH_POWER_TABLE_PARAMS

Member.comment: Temperature range for Tx D-type parameters
Member.name: tx_dtype_temp

Member.comment: Tx D-type values to be used for each temperature range
Member.name: tx_dtype_conf

Member.comment: Temperature range for Tx E-type parameters
Member.name: tx_etype_temp

Member.comment: Tx E-type values to be used for each temperature range.\nThe last 4 values of any range are the first 4 values of the next range and so on
Member.name: tx_etype_conf

Member.comment: Temperature range for Rx D-type parameters
Member.name: rx_dtype_temp

Member.comment: Rx D-type values to be used for each temperature range
Member.name: rx_dtype_conf

Member.comment: Temperature range for Rx E-type parameters
Member.name: rx_etype_temp

Member.comment: Rx E-type values to be used for each temperature range.\nThe last 4 values of any range are the first 4 values of the next range and so on
Member.name: rx_etype_conf

Member.comment: Rx to Tx gain index offset
Member.name: rx_2_tx_offs

Struct.comment:
WMI_FIXED_SCHEDULING_UL_CONFIG_CMDID
This API sets rd parameter per mcs.
Relevant only in Fixed Scheduling mode.
Returned event: WMI_FIXED_SCHEDULING_UL_CONFIG_EVENTID
Struct.name: FIXED_SCHEDULING_UL_CONFIG
